alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:16PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany, northwestern Laramie and southern Platte Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 316 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Horse Creek, or 13 miles northeast of Laramie, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Horse Creek around 335 PM MDT. Iron Mountain around 340 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 28 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
